name: Move
description: The 'mv' command is a utility in Unix-like operating systems used for moving and renaming files and directories. It allows a user to move one or more files or directories from one place to another. If both the source and destination are on the same filesystem, this results in a simple inode movement. If they are on different filesystems, mv performs a copy followed by a delete of the original. This command is essential for file management, helps in organizing files, and can also be used to rename files.
